comments.body: Does this mean we are dependent on `gsl`? Given `cythongsl` seems to be header only, could we please add `gsl` here too if we are linking to it?

> cythongsl depends on gsl. To avoid over-specifying the dependencies you can remove gsl from both build and run sections.

[quote](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/1018#discussion-diff-70455031) from @ocefpaf

The problem with this is @mmb90 and @ocefpaf `slda` is actually [linking](https://travis-ci.org/conda-forge/staged-recipes/jobs/146218765#L1129) to `gsl` unlike `cythongsl`. As a result, if `gsl` gets updated and we don't have a way to properly pin it here (e.g. `gsl` is not listed), this will end up being broken. As this has been merged in spite of this comment, I would please ask you to fix it in the feedstock.
The dependency tree is known we should improve our tools to do this instead of working around it by over-specifying.

Maybe that has merit in the general case. Happy to discuss that with you elsewhere. However I don't think it applies here.

`cythongsl` is a header only library and as such does not break when the ABI of `gsl` changes. However, `slda` that links to `gsl` will be broken if `gsl`'s ABI changes. I don't think we are over-specifying by providing this additional detail about ABI sensitivity.
